Project Overview PADERCLEAN is a professional car detailing service (interior-focused vehicle cleaning) based in Paderborn, Germany. We need a modern, responsive web application for PADERCLEAN, implemented as an Angular 20 single-page application (SPA) with multiple views (Home, About, Services, References, Contact, etc.), and a Node.js/Express backend for handling form submissions (email sending) and security logic. The site should reflect PADERCLEAN’s corporate identity (colors, logo) and meet high standards of design, performance, security, and SEO. Key Requirements and Features Framework & Technology: Use Angular v20 (TypeScript) for the front-end SPA, following the latest best practices (standalone components, OnPush change detection, Angular Signals for state, etc.). Use Node.js + Express for the backend (to handle the contact form email and any server-side needs). Ensure the app is built with modern Angular features and clean architecture (e.g., use Angular CLI for project setup, Angular Routing for multiple pages, lazy-loaded routes for performance, etc.). Design & Front-End: Responsive Multi-Page Layout: Implement a multi-page feel with Angular routing (pages: Home, Über Uns (About), Leistungen (Services), Referenzen (References), Kontakt (Contact), plus legal pages Impressum, Datenschutz, AGB). Each page should be a separate view/component. Corporate Identity: Apply PADERCLEAN’s branding – use the new car silhouette logo across the site (e.g., in the header, hero section). The logo in the header should be clickable and link back to the home page. Color Scheme: Use the specified brand colors: Primary Dark #0c1d36, Primary Blue #3a6ea5, Light Blue #d6e8f0, White #ffffff, Text Dark #333333, Text Light #666666 for backgrounds, accents, text, etc. Define these in CSS (consider using CSS custom properties for maintainability). Typography: Use modern, clean fonts – e.g. Montserrat or Poppins for headlines and Nunito or Roboto for body text. Include these via Google Fonts. Ensure headings and body text have appropriate font-weights (headlines semi-bold/bold, body light/regular as given). Layout & Styling: Use HTML5 semantic elements and CSS3 (Flexbox/Grid) to create a clean, accessible layout. Implement a mobile-first design that looks good on mobile (smartphones) and scales up to tablets and desktops. The site should be tested in modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, iOS/Android browsers). Images & Icons: Integrate Font Awesome 6.4.0 for icons (e.g., service icons, social icons). Use NgOptimizedImage for optimizing images in Angular (for any static images like logos or gallery photos) to improve loading performance angular.dev angular.dev . Provide a favicon and a full set of PWA/manifest icons (so the site can be added to home screen). Animations: Add subtle, polished animations for better UX – for example, fade-in sections on scroll, hover effects on buttons, or an interactive before/after image slider. Use Angular’s built-in animation capabilities or CSS transitions. Keep animations lightweight and performance-friendly. Cookie Consent Banner: Implement a GDPR-compliant cookie consent banner. On first visit, it should inform users about cookie usage (e.g., for analytics) and allow them to accept or adjust settings. Once accepted, the choice should be saved (e.g., in localStorage or a cookie) so that the banner does not show again unnecessarily answers.netlify.com . The banner should appear on all pages until consent is given, and users should be able to reopen/adjust their cookie settings (link in footer). Backend & Functionality: Contact Form Backend: Set up an Express.js server (Node.js) to handle form submissions from the Contact page. When a user submits the contact form, the backend should: Validate the input (to prevent spam/abuse). Verify the reCAPTCHA v3 token with Google’s API. Send an email with the inquiry details to the business owner’s email (and optionally send a confirmation to the user) using Nodemailer. Use the provided Strato SMTP settings (host smtp.strato.de, port 465, SSL, auth user infopaderclean.de, pass from env) for sending emails. (These credentials should be configurable via environment variables, not hard-coded, for security.) angular.dev Respond with a success or error message that the Angular app can display to the user. Express Server Security: Harden the Node.js backend with security middleware: use Helmet for secure headers, enable CORS only for the front-end’s domain, apply rate limiting (e.g., max 5 form submissions per 15 minutes per IP) to prevent abuse angular.dev , and ensure any user input is sanitized (to prevent injection attacks in email or logs). Also implement CSRF protection if the form is served on the same domain (or ensure that the REST endpoint is protected against CSRF by design/token). No Server-Side Rendering (optional): The Angular app can be a client-side rendered SPA. However, for SEO purposes you might consider using Angular Universal for SSR or prerendering. If not using SSR, ensure the dynamic meta tags are handled on the client. (This is optional since search engines can crawl SPAs, but SSR would improve initial load and SEO.) Security Features (Front-end): Use Angular’s built-in XSS protection (Angular auto-sanitizes interpolations) – avoid directly inserting any untrusted HTML. Ensure forms use Angular’s form validation and possibly additional HTML5 validation attributes. Display friendly validation errors to the user for required fields or bad input. Integrate Google reCAPTCHA v3 on the frontend: include the reCAPTCHA script, obtain a token on form submit, and send it to the backend for verification. (No UI challenge is shown to the user, but you must check the score on the server and decide if the submission seems legitimate.) HTTPS: The site will be served over HTTPS (Strato hosting + SSL certificate). Enforce HTTPS links for any resources. If any mixed content or external scripts (like Google Maps, fonts, etc.), ensure they load over https. SEO Optimization: Set appropriate Meta Tags (title, description, keywords) for each page. Use Angular’s Meta and Title services to update these on route change (for SPA without SSR). Include Open Graph and Twitter Card tags in the HTML for social sharing (e.g., title, description, image (perhaps a nice image of a clean car or PADERCLEAN logo)). Add structured data (Schema.org JSON-LD) for local business and relevant services. For example, include organization markup with name, address, phone, opening hours, etc., and perhaps use schema for “Auto detailing service” .Provide an XML Sitemap (sitemap.xml) covering all important URLs, and a robots.txt file that permits crawling. (These can be static files placed in the deployment, not necessarily generated by Angular.) Use breadcrumb navigation on applicable pages (and mark it up with Schema.org if possible) – for example, on subpages show “Home > Services > …” .Target local SEO keywords like “Fahrzeugaufbereitung Paderborn” in headings or content where appropriate (without overstuffing), since the business is local. Performance Optimization: Bundling & Minification: Use Angular’s production build which will bundle and minify JS/CSS. Ensure any additional scripts or styles are also minified. Compression: Enable GZIP or Brotli compression on the server for text assets (HTML, JS, CSS) to improve load times. Caching: Set far-future cache headers for static assets (with proper file hashing via Angular CLI) so that repeat visits are faster. The HTML (or main index) can have a shorter cache. Image Optimization: Use optimized images (compressed JPEGs/PNGs, or WebP format) and responsive image sizes. Possibly use for automatic optimizations angular.dev . Implement lazy loading for offscreen images (Angular’s default loading="lazy" on images or manual intersection observer if needed). Fast Loading: Aim for a Google PageSpeed Insights score of 90+ by eliminating render-blocking resources (Angular will inline critical CSS by default), minimizing third-party scripts, and keeping the bundle size lean. PWA & HTTP/2: Leverage HTTP/2 by serving assets over it (most modern hosts do this automatically with HTTPS). Set up the app as a Progressive Web App (PWA) using Angular’s PWA support (ng add angular/pwa) so that it can cache assets and even work offline. Include a web app manifest with the provided icons and name. Über PADERCLEAN – Meine Leidenschaft für saubere Fahrzeuge

Schon seit vielen Jahren habe ich eine große Leidenschaft dafür, Autos bis ins kleinste Detail zu pflegen und sauber zu halten. Angefangen hat alles ganz privat: Ich habe zunächst die Fahrzeuge von Familie, Freunden und natürlich mein eigenes Auto gereinigt. Dabei habe ich schnell gemerkt, wie viel Freude es mir bereitet, wenn ein Fahrzeug nach der Reinigung wieder wie neu wirkt – frisch riecht, glänzt und seinen Besitzern ein gutes Gefühl gibt.

Mit der Zeit habe ich meine Techniken perfektioniert und mich dazu entschieden, aus meinem Hobby mehr zu machen. So ist PADERCLEAN entstanden – mit dem Ziel, anderen Menschen das gleiche Gefühl von Freude und Zufriedenheit zu schenken.

Denn ich bin überzeugt: Ein sauberes Auto ist mehr als nur ein optischer Luxus. Es macht den Alltag angenehmer, sorgt für Wohlbefinden und unterstreicht die eigene Lebensqualität.
Mit Liebe zum Detail, Leidenschaft und dem Anspruch, jedes Auto so zu behandeln, als wäre es mein eigenes, sorge ich dafür, dass Sie Ihr Fahrzeug wieder rundum genießen können.
